description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESPECT OF THE PROPOSED CHANGE OF USE FROM USE CLASS C3 (DWELLINGHOUSE) TO C4 (SMALL HMO) AND ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The erection of a single storey rear extension would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class A of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class A. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - The operations consist of the use of 11 Netley Gardens Morden Surrey SM4 6JW as a small House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) under C4 Use Class, in that the residential unit is used by three to six unrelated people. The development constitutes permitted development within the meaning of Class L, of Part 3 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class L. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 3 - Informative: The applicant is reminded that properties of 5 or more persons require a HMO License from the Council as per the Housing Act 2004 Part 2. See more information at: Licensing of houses in multiple occupation | Merton Council

Condition : 4 - Informative: The applicant is reminded that the certificate applies to the use of the property for as a small HMO. Should the occupancy exceed 6 persons (Sui Generis), planning permission will be required.
